p: Lipases display high specificity towards different length and type of fatty acids of triacylglycerol molecules (acyl donor) and the length of alcohol (acyl acceptor) [42]. Thus, lipases should be nonstereo specific, so that all tri-, di-, and monoacylglycerols can be converted to the correspondent monoalkyl esters (biodiesel). At the same time, they should also catalyze the esterification of free fatty acids [43].
